document.docAuthor: Eberle, Jonas, Tänzler, Rene & Riedel, Alexander
document.docTitle: Thyestetha glabra Eberle & Riedel, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the Papuan weevil genus Thyestetha Pascoe (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Cryptorhynchinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision and phylogenetic analysis of the Papuan weevil genus Thyestetha Pascoe (Coleoptera, Curculionidae, Cryptorhynchinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Prothorax 1.2 X wider than long; anterior 1 / 4 of disc punctate with small punctures, remainder subglabrous and with minute punctures (except for row of coarse punctures along base); sides punctate with small punctures; postocular lobe coarsely punctate with larger punctures; marginal carina externally along edge with few whitish scales; inner surface of rostral canal with scattered long setae.

Elytra as long as wide; sides rounded; apex slightly extended, jointly rounded; striae effaced on elytral disc, striae 8 and 9 apically distinct; interstices between punctures of stria 8 equal to diameter of punctures, interstices between punctures of stria 9 small. Metanepisternum 3.7 X wider than high.

Thoracic venter. Meso- and metaventrite laterally with sparse small scales; metaventrite submedially behind mesocoxa with pair of moderate protrusions. Pro- and mesocoxa densely punctate, squamose; metacoxa glabrous; trochanter with sparse, coarse punctures containing small scales. Distance between mesocoxae subequal to width of mesocoxa.

Legs. Femora basally sparsely punctate, apically denser, scales slender; meso- and metafemur dorsally with broader scales; metafemur with denser scaling, dorsal squamose line moderately dense; anteroventral ridges relatively weak; with posteroventral ridge in apical third moderately protruding.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen. Ventrite 1 laterally and center of ventrite 2 with few thin scales arising from punctures; remaining ventrites subglabrous except lateral margins slightly squamose.

Terminalia. Aedeagus ( Figs. 41, 42 ). Apex strongly curved ventrad, sides converging in straight line; lateral orificial sclerites small, outer portion
2– 3
X longer than inner portion; anterior median orificial sclerite with small bulge between 2 nd and 3 rd fold (as in
Fig. 35
) Transfer apparatus in profile shallowly incised at middle, ventral contour angularly projecting; anterior and posterior ends curved ventrad; in dorsal view strongly constricted at middle, anterior portion narrower than posterior portion. Sclerotized part of ventral membrane extending proximad 0.71 X length of aedeagal body from insertion of apodemes.

Allotype, female. Same as holotype except: Rostrum 6.1 X longer than wide. Prothorax 1.2 X longer than wide. Elytra 1.0 X longer than wide; extreme apex slightly more slender. Metafemur without concavity basal to stridulatory patch, posteroventral ridge not protruding. Terminalia. Hemisternites of ovipositor 5.75 X longer than wide. Tergite VII 1.67 X longer than wide. Tergite VIII 2.50 X longer than wide. Bursal sclerite at insertion of spermathecal duct weakly sclerotized.

Intraspecific variation. Size: Length 3.7–4.3 mm (n= 3 , x = 4.1 mm ) in males, 4.1–4.9 mm (n= 3 , x = 4.5 mm ± 0.4 mm ) in females. Legs black or dark ferruginous (few specimens). Male terminalia. Spiculum gastrale of slightly variable length.
Etymology. The epithet is based on the Latin adjective glaber, -bra, -brum (hairless, smooth) and refers to the smooth dorsal surface of this species.

51 males
,

).
